de.polygonal.ds.DA<T>

type
class
implements
Collection<T>

A dense, dynamic array.

Worst-case running time in Big O notation

Constructor

new(?reservedSize : Int, ?maxSize : Int)

parameters
reservedSize the initial capacity of the internal container. See reserve().
maxSize the maximum allowed size of this dense array.
The default value of -1 indicates that there is no upper limit.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError reserved size is greater than allowed size (debug only).

Instance Variables

key : Int

A unique identifier for this object.
A hash table transforms this key into an index of an array element by using a hash function.
This value should never be changed by the user.

maxSize : Int

The maximum allowed size of this dense array.
Once the maximum size is reached, adding an element will fail with an error (debug only).
A value of -1 indicates that the size is unbound.
Always equals -1 in release mode.

reuseIterator : Bool

If true, reuses the iterator object instead of allocating a new one when calling iterator().
The default is false.
If true, nested iterations are likely to fail as only one iteration is allowed at a time.

Instance Methods

assign(C : Class<T>, ?args : Array<Dynamic>, ?n : Int) : Void

parameters
C the class to instantiate for each element.
args passes additional constructor arguments to the class C.
n the number of elements to replace. If 0, n is set to size().
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError n out of range (debug only).
Replaces up to n existing elements with objects of type C. n

inline back() : T

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError index out of range (debug only).
Returns the last element.
This is the element at index size() - 1. 1

inline clear(?purge : Bool) : Void

parameters
purge if true, elements are nullified upon removal.
Removes all elements. 1 or n if purge is true

clone(?assign : Bool, ?copier : T -> T) : Collection<T>

parameters
assign if true, the copier parameter is ignored and primitive elements are copied by value whereas objects are copied by reference.
If false, the clone() method is called on each element. In this case all elements have to implement Cloneable.
copier a custom function for copying elements. Replaces element.clone() if assign is false.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError element is not of type Cloneable (debug only).
Duplicates this dense array. Supports shallow (structure only) and deep copies (structure & elements).

concat(x : DA<T>, ?copy : Bool) : DA<T>

parameters
copy if true, returns a new array instead of modifying this array.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError x is null (debug only).
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError x equals this if copy=false (debug only).
Concatenates this array with x by appending all elements of x to this array. n

inline contains(x : T) : Bool

Returns true if this queue contains the element x. n

inline cpy(i : Int, j : Int) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError index out of range or i equals j (debug only).
Replaces the element at index i with the element from index j. 1

fill(x : T, ?n : Int) : Void

parameters
n the number of elements to replace. If 0, n is set to size().
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError n out of range (debug only).
Replaces up to n existing elements with the instance of x. n

free() : Void

Destroys this object by explicitly nullifying all elements for GC'ing used resources.
Improves GC efficiency/performance (optional). n

inline front() : T

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError index out of range (debug only).
Returns the first element.
This is the element at index 0. 1

inline get(i : Int) : T

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError index out of range (debug only).
Returns the element stored at index i. 1

inline getArray() : Array<T>

Grants access to the internal array storing the elements of this dense array.
Useful for fast iteration or low-level operations.
The length of the array doesn't have to match size(). 1

inline getNext(i : Int) : T

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError index out of range (debug only).
Returns the element stored at index i + 1.
The index wraps around when i equals size(). n

inline getPrev(i : Int) : T

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError index out of range (debug only).
Returns the element stored at index i - 1.
The index wraps around when i equals 0. 1

inline inRange(i : Int) : Bool

Returns true if the index i is valid for reading a value. 1

indexOf(x : T, ?from : Int, ?binarySearch : Bool, ?comparator : T -> T -> Int) : Int

parameters
from the index to start from. The default value is 0.
binarySearch use the binary search algorithm. Requires that the elements are sorted.
comparator a comparison function for the binary search. If omitted, the method assumes that all elements implement Comparable.
returns
the index storing the element x or -1 if x was not found.
If binarySearch is true, returns the index of x or the bitwise complement (~) of the index where the x would be inserted (guaranteed to be a negative number).
The insertion point is only valid iffrom=0.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError from index out of range (debug only).
Finds the first occurrence of the element x (by incrementing indices - from left to right). n

inline insertAt(i : Int, x : T) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError index out of range (debug only).
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError size() equals maxSize (debug only).
Inserts x at the specified index i.
Shifts the element currently at that position (if any) and any subsequent elements to the right (indices + 1). n

inline isEmpty() : Bool

Returns true if this dense array is empty. 1

iterator() : Itr<T>

see
http://haxe.org/ref/iterators
Returns a new DAIterator object to iterate over all elements contained in this dense array.
Preserves the natural order of an array.

join(x : String) : String

Converts the data in this dense array to strings, inserts x between the elements, concatenates them, and returns the resulting string. n

lastIndexOf(x : T, ?from : Int) : Int

parameters
from the index to start from. By default, the method starts from the last element in this dense array.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError from index out of range (debug only).
Finds the first occurrence of x (by decrementing indices - from right to left) and returns the index storing the element x or -1 if x was not found. n

inline memmove(destination : Int, source : Int, n : Int) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError invalid destination, source or n value (debug only).
see
http://www.cplusplus.com/reference/clibrary/cstring/memmove/
Copies n elements from the location pointed by the index source to the location pointed by the index destination.
Copying takes place as if an intermediate buffer was used, allowing the destination and source to overlap. n

pack() : Void

For performance reasons the dense array does nothing to ensure that empty locations contain null.
pack() therefore nullifies all obsolete references and shrinks the container to the actual size allowing the garbage collector to reclaim used memory. n

inline popBack() : T

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError array is empty (debug only).
Removes and returns the last element. 1

inline popFront() : T

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError array is empty (debug only).
Removes and returns the first element.
To fill the gap, any subsequent elements are shifted to the left (indices - 1). n

inline pushBack(x : T) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError size() equals maxSize (debug only).
Appends the element x to the last element. 1

inline pushFront(x : T) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError size() equals maxSize (debug only).
Prepends the element x to the first element.
Shifts the first element (if any) and any subsequent elements to the right (indices + 1). n

remove(x : T) : Bool

returns
true if at least one occurrence of x was removed.
Removes and nullifies all occurrences of the element x.
n

inline removeAt(i : Int) : T

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError index out of range (debug only).
Removes the element at the specified index i.
Shifts any subsequent elements to the left (indices - 1). n

removeRange(i : Int, n : Int, ?output : DA<T>) : DA<T>

parameters
output stores the removed elements. If omitted, the removed elements are lost.
returns
a dense array storing all removed elements or null if output is omitted.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError i or n out of range (debug only).
Removes n elements starting at the specified index i in the range [i, i + n]. n

reserve(x : Int) : Void

Preallocates internal space for storing x elements.
This is useful if the expected size is known in advance - many platforms can optimize memory usage if an exact size is specified. n

reverse() : Void

Reverses this dense array in place. n

inline set(i : Int, x : T) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError index out of range or maximum size reached (debug only).
Replaces the element at index i with the element x.
1

shuffle(?rval : DA<Float>) : Void

parameters
rval a list of random double values in the range between 0 (inclusive) to 1 (exclusive) defining the new positions of the elements. If omitted, random values are generated on-the-fly by calling Math.random().
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError insufficient random values (debug only).
Shuffles the elements of this collection by using the Fisher-Yates algorithm.
n

inline size() : Int

The total number of elements. 1

sort(compare : T -> T -> Int, ?useInsertionSort : Bool, ?first : Int, ?count : Int) : Void

parameters
compare a comparison function.
If null, the elements are compared using element.compare().
In this case all elements have to implement Comparable.
useInsertionSort if true, the dense array is sorted using the insertion sort algorithm. This is faster for nearly sorted lists.
first sort start index. The default value is 0.
count the number of elements to sort (range: [first, first + count]).
If omitted, count is set to the remaining elements (size() - first).
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError element does not implement Comparable (debug only).
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError first or count out of bound (debug only).
Sorts the elements of this dense array using the quick sort algorithm.
n²

inline swapPop(i : Int) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError index out of range (debug only).
Fast removal of the element at index i if the order of the elements doesn't matter. 1

inline swp(i : Int, j : Int) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError index out of range or i equals j (debug only).
Swaps the element stored at index i with the element stored at index j. 1

toArray() : Array<T>

Returns an array containing all elements in this dense array.
Preserves the natural order of this array.

toDA() : DA<T>

Returns a dense array containing all elements in this queue.
Preserves the natural order of this array.

toString() : String

Returns a string representing the current object.
Example:
	  var da = new de.polygonal.ds.DA<Int>(10);
	  for (i in 0...3) {
	      da.set(i, i);
	  }
	  trace(da);
	  {DA, size/max: 3/10}
	  |<
	    0 -> 0
	    1 -> 1
	    2 -> 2
	  >|

toVector() : flash.Vector<Dynamic>

Returns a Vector.<T> object containing all elements in this dense array.
Preserves the natural order of this array.

inline trim(x : Int) : Void

parameters
x the new size of this dense array.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError new size > current size() (debug only).
Trims the dense array by cutting of size() - x elements.
This only modifies the size(). To enable instant garbage collection of all cut off elements and to shrink the internal array to the new size, call pack() afterwards. 1
